sentences: Claus Adam (November 5, 1917 – July 4, 1983) was an American cellist and cello teacher as well as a composer.
He served as the second cellist of the Juilliard String Quartet, replacing Arthur Winograd in 1955.
Joel Krosnick, a former student of his, replaced him as cellist of the quartet in 1974.
He devoted the last decade of his life primarily to musical composition, and several of his works—including a cello concerto and a string trio—are published by G. Schirmer.
Adam lived in Indonesia until he was six.
He then went to Europe and studied in Salzburg.
In 1929 he went to the USA.
